    • Constructor Detail

      • Transaction

        public Transaction(Address destAddress)

      • Transaction

        public Transaction(Address destAddress,
                   Timestamp lockTime)
        Creates a reward transaction (transaction with no source address). The resulting transaction is without signature.
        Parameters:
        lockTime - time of the creation of the transaction (if null: lockTime is considered to be current timestamp)
        destAddress - Address of the destination
        See Also:
        Parameters.MINING_REWARD

      • Transaction

        public Transaction(Address srcAddress,
                   Address destAddress,
                   Integer amount,
                   List<TransactionOutput> referencedOutputs)
        Creates a transaction without a signature.
        Parameters:
        srcAddress - Source address of the transaction
        destAddress - Destination address of the transaction
        amount - Number of CrashCoins received by the destination address
        referencedOutputs - List of referenced outputs, used as inputs

      • Transaction

        public Transaction(org.json.JSONObject json)
        Create Transaction instance from a JSON representation. This transaction already contains a signature.
        Parameters:
        json -

        the JSONObject representation

      • sign

        public void sign(PrivateKey privateKey)
        Add signature of the payer to the transaction. Transactions signature is performed by DSA.
        Parameters:
        privateKey - the private key of the payer (signer)
        See Also:
        Cryptography.signData(java.security.PrivateKey, byte[])

      • setSignature

        public void setSignature(byte[] signature)
        Define the signature. Only for genesis block
        Parameters:
        signature - byte of the signature

      • before

        public boolean before(Transaction other)
        Checks that the transaction is older that the other transaction
        Parameters:
        other - the transaction which timestamp is tested
        Returns:
        true if this very transaction is older that the other one.

      • isReward

        public boolean isReward()

      • isValidReward

        public boolean isValidReward()
        Returns true if the transaction is a valid mining reward, false otherwise. A mining reward is valid if it meets all of these conditions :
        - it is a mining reward (the change output is null)
        - the input array is null
        - the amount equals Parameters.MINING_REWARD
        Returns:
        true if the transaction is valid as described, false otherwise
        See Also:
        Parameters.MINING_REWARD

      • isValidNonReward

        public boolean isValidNonReward()
        Returns true if the standalone transaction is valid and is not a mining reward, false otherwise. A non-reward transaction is valid if it meets all of these conditions :
        - the sum of inputs equals the sum of outputs
        - each output value is strictly positive
        - the transaction data is digitally signed by the sender
        Returns:
        true if the transaction is valid as described, false otherwise

      • toBytes

        public byte[] toBytes()
        Creates a byte representation of a transaction. The attributes of the transaction are converted to byte arrays and then concatenated. A transaction requires a byte representation to be able to pass it to a signature algorithm.
        Returns:
        Bytes of the transaction

      • getDestAddress

        public Address getDestAddress()
        Return the address of the payee.
        Returns:

      • getSrcAddress

        public Address getSrcAddress()
        Return the address of the payer.
        Returns:

      • getInputs

        public ArrayList<TransactionInput> getInputs()
        Get the list of transactions outputs references that are used as inputs in this very transaction. A TransactionInput is basically a hash of a transaction output, and the amount of that output.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of TransactionInputs
        See Also:
        TransactionInput, TransactionOutput

      • getTransactionOutput

        public TransactionOutput getTransactionOutput()
        Get the transaction output. As opposed to the changeOutput, the transaction output is the output of the transaction that is destinated to the payee (receiver of the payement).
        Returns:
        the output to the payee.
        See Also:
        getChangeOutput, transactionOutput, changeOutput

      • getChangeOutput

        public TransactionOutput getChangeOutput()
        Get the change output. As opposed to the transactionOutput, the change output is the output representing the change, i.e. when a wallet makes a transaction, it pays a certain amount of Crashcoins. If it pays too much, the remaining Crashcoins are redirected to its address as a change output.
        Returns:
        the change output
        See Also:
        getChangeOutput, transactionOutput, changeOutput
